label: none

clause: Objection, restriction, and withdrawal of consent: You can object to or request that we restrict processing of your personal information.
label: none

clause: If we have collected and are processing your personal information with your consent, then you can withdraw your consent at any time.
label: none

clause: Withdrawing your consent will not affect the lawfulness of any processing we conducted prior to your withdrawal, nor will it affect processing of your personal information conducted in reliance on lawful processing grounds other than consent.
label: none

clause: For more information, please see help.netflix.com/node/100637.
label: none

clause: Right to complain: You have the right to complain to a data protection authority about our processing of your personal information but we encourage you to first contact us with any questions or concerns.

clause: Matched Identifier Communications from Netflix.
label: none

clause: Some third party services allow us to reach users with online marketing about Netflix content or the Netflix service by sending privacy protected contact information to the third party.
label: data_sharing

clause: Privacy protected contact information means we use pseudonymization technologies (such as hashing) to convert the original contact information (such as an email address or phone number) into a value (typically a long alphanumeric sequence of characters) that cannot, by itself, reveal your identity or contact information.
label: none

clause: The third party compares Netflix’s privacy protected contact information with privacy protected contact information in its own database and there will be a match only if you have used the same contact information with both Netflix and the third party.
label: data_sharing

clause: If there is a match, Netflix can then choose whether or not to send Netflix marketing to you on that third party service, and can optimize and better measure the effectiveness of such marketing.
label: data_sharing

clause: You can indicate your choices regarding the Matched Identifier Communications in the “Privacy and data settings” (for the relevant profile) within the “Account” section of our website.

clause: If your behavioral advertisements setting is off, you will still see Advertisements, but they will be non-behavioral advertisements.

clause: Removing device access to your Netflix account: To remove access to your Netflix account from devices that are logged into the account, visit the “Account” section of our website, locate the “Sign out of all devices” option, and follow the instructions to sign out of your devices.

clause: Users of public or shared devices should log out at the completion of each session.
label: none

clause: If you sell or return a computer or Netflix ready device, be sure to first log out.
label: none

clause: If you or other users on the account do not maintain the security of your email address, password, and signed-in devices, or fail to log out a device you sell or return, then others may be able to access your Netflix account, including your personal information.

clause: Section D: Cookies and other Technologies We, our Service Providers, Netflix Marketing Providers, and Advertising Companies use cookies, other similar technologies (such as pixel tags), hashed identifiers, and resettable device identifiers for various reasons.
label: tracking

clause: This section explains the types of technologies used, what they do, and your corresponding choices.
label: none

clause: To choose whether or not to receive cookies and similar technologies, please see the section below “How can I exercise choice regarding these technologies?” Cookies and Similar Technologies, Pixel Tags, Hashed Identifiers, and Resettable Device Identifiers Cookies are small data files that are commonly stored on your device when you access websites and online services.
label: tracking

clause: The text in a cookie contains a string of numbers and letters that may uniquely identify a device and can contain other information as well.
label: none

clause: This allows the web server to recognize your browser each time it connects to that web server.
label: none

clause: We use other technologies such as browser storage and plugins (for example, HTML5, IndexedDB, and WebSQL).
label: none

clause: Like cookies, these other technologies may store small amounts of data on a device.
label: tracking

clause: Pixel tags often work in conjunction with cookies.
label: tracking

clause: In many cases, declining cookies will impair the effectiveness of pixel tags associated with those cookies.
label: tracking

clause: We may also create, use, and disclose hashed identifiers.
label: none

clause: As described above, hashing is a process of converting the original contact information (such as an email address or phone number) into a value (typically a long alphanumeric sequence of characters) that cannot, by itself, reveal your identity or contact information.
label: none

clause: If you use a Netflix app (such as the main Netflix app, or a Netflix game app) on a mobile device, tablet, or streaming media device, we may collect a resettable device identifier from your device.
label: none

clause: Resettable device identifiers can be used like cookies and are found on many mobile devices and tablets (for example, the “Identifier for Advertisers” on Apple iOS devices and the “Google Advertising ID” on Android devices), and certain streaming media devices.
label: tracking

clause: Why Does Netflix Use These Technologies?
label: none

clause: We use these types of technologies for various reasons, including to provide our service (for example, by making it easy to access our service by remembering you when you return); to administer and operate our business, to research, analyze and improve our services (for example, to improve site performance, monitor visitor traffic and actions on our site, and to test the effectiveness of our user interface); to send marketing and informational messages (for example, to deliver and tailor our marketing, and to understand interactions with our emails, marketing, and marketing on third party services); to support Advertisements; for safety, security and fraud prevention; and to comply with law and enforce the Netflix Terms of Use.
label: data_sharing

clause: These technologies enable Netflix Marketing Providers to collect personal information (such as the pages you visit and device and network information) when you use our services, and Netflix Marketing Providers may also collect information about your online activities over time across different websites.
label: none

clause: We use pixel tags in our emails to understand how members interact with our service.
label: none

clause: Our use of pixel tags helps us understand when links within messages are clicked, or the emails are opened.
label: none

clause: Netflix uses hashed identifiers and resettable device identifiers to display marketing for our service or Netflix content on third party services, to support Advertisements (including delivering Advertisements to you), and for analytics and optimization purposes.
label: data_sharing

clause: To learn more about the types of cookies used by Netflix, please click here.
label: tracking

clause: How can I exercise choice regarding these technologies?
label: none

clause: To exercise choice regarding cookies For more information about cookies set through our service and to exercise choices regarding cookies, click here.
label: tracking

clause: We do not currently respond to web browser “do not track" signals.
label: tracking

clause: To exercise choice regarding hashed identifiers for Netflix Marketing To exercise choice regarding Netflix's use of hashed identifiers for Netflix marketing communications on third party services, please configure the appropriate setting under Matched Identifier Communications in the "Privacy and data settings" (for the relevant profile) within the "Account" section of our website.
label: data_sharing

clause: To exercise choice regarding resettable device identifiers To exercise choice regarding Netflix’s use of resettable device identifiers (for marketing the Netflix service or Netflix content, or as used to support Advertisements), please configure the appropriate setting on your device (usually found under "privacy" or "ads" in your device settings).
label: tracking

clause: If you choose not to allow this, you may still see marketing messages promoting Netflix and Advertisements on that device but it will not be selected based on the use of a resettable device identifier.
label: none

clause: Note that your choice regarding the resettable device identifier is specific to that device.
label: none

clause: To exercise choice regarding other similar technologies In addition to any choices we may offer you in the Netflix service, there are several ways to exercise choice regarding technologies that are similar to cookies, such as browser storage and plugins (for example, HTML5, IndexedDB, and WebSQL).
label: tracking

clause: For example, many popular browsers provide the ability to clear browser storage, typically in the settings or preferences area.
label: none

clause: See your browser's help function or support area to learn more.
label: none

clause: Most email clients have settings that allow you to prevent the automatic downloading of images, including pixel tags, and the automatic connection to the web servers that host those images.
label: none

clause: Other technologies may be cleared from within the application.
label: none

clause: In addition to these choices, if you want to exercise your choices for behavioral advertising on Netflix, please see “Advertising Choices” above.
label: none

clause: Netflix Games Supplemental Privacy Disclosures When you play Netflix games, we will collect, use, and disclose your personal information as described in the Netflix Privacy Statement.

clause: The Categories of Personal Information We Collect When you play Netflix games, we collect the categories of personal information described in the Netflix Privacy Statement.
label: none

clause: If you play games with the features mentioned above (or similar features), the following provides additional examples of the personal information we may collect: Netflix account/profile information: We collect information that may be associated with your Netflix account/profile, such as your friend or team list selections and the names of those teams, when you use features such as local multiplayer (for example, when players connect to your “Netflix Game on TV” by scanning a code on the TV) and online multiplayer (interacting with other online players who are logged into their Netflix accounts).
label: none

clause: Usage Information: We collect information about you and your use of Netflix games, such as: Your leaderboard status, score, and game achievements; Whether you are online and/or playing a game in order to display your online or availability status to other players in the game and/or to your friend or team list; Your searches for and connections with other players within a Netflix game (for example, searching for and connecting to a player); Your gameplay, interactions, or chat with other players as a part of local multiplayer and online multiplayer features; Your reports of violations of the Netflix Games Community Guidelines (help.netflix.com/legal/gamescommunityguidelines) and any similar guidelines for Netflix games, and reports from other players about your potential violations; and Your input of user-generated content within a Netflix game, such as drawings, uploaded content (such as photos, videos, sound recordings, or other content), or your selection of content from a third party service.
label: data_sharing

clause: Device and network information: When you use Netflix game controller functionality to connect to a Netflix game (such as a “Netflix Game on TV”), we collect information about the app, device, and the Netflix account (if you are logged in) on which the Netflix game controller is running.
label: none

clause: How We Use Your Personal Information When you play Netflix games, we use personal information as described in the Netflix Privacy Statement.
label: none

clause: If you play games with the features mentioned above (or similar features), the following provides additional examples of how we may use your personal information: To provide our service: When you play Netflix games that include these features (or similar features), we use your personal information in order to provide the game including the features, as described below.
label: none

clause: We use the following categories of personal information used to provide our service with these features: Netflix account/profile information, usage information, and device and network information.
label: none

clause: In particular: For features such as leaderboards and game achievements, we use your personal information (such as your game handle), in order to display the leaderboard and achievements to you and other players; For features that enable you to find or interact with other players in Netflix games (such as online multiplayer games), we use your personal information and the personal information you provide about others in order to find that player and send them your connection request (and for them to find you and send you a connection request); For online multiplayer games, we may use the general location of your device (such as your city, state/province, or country) to match you with other players that are close to the relevant game server so that your gameplay is less likely to be interrupted by internet delays; For communication features, such as chat, we transmit communications you send to another player or group of players and deliver communications they send to you.
label: none

clause: Note that we may use Service Providers to perform services related to these communications on our behalf (as described in the Privacy Statement), which may include providing chat, moderation, and related services; and For user-generated content features, we use your personal information to display your user-generated content to other players in the Netflix game, or in accordance with how you have shared the user-generated content (for example, on a third party service).

label: none

clause: Privacy Policy Effective: April 7, 2025 Welcome to Snap Inc.’s Privacy Policy.
label: none

clause: This Policy explains how we collect and use your data and how you can control your information.
label: none

clause: Looking for a quick summary on our privacy practices?
label: none

clause: If you’re looking for specific product privacy information, for example, how we process your Chats and Snaps, take a look at our Privacy by Product page.
label: none

clause: In addition to these documents, we also show in-app notices that provide you more information about our products and services.
label: none

clause: And if you’re a Spectacles user you can learn more on how we collect and use your data in the Spectacles Supplemental Privacy Policy.
label: none

clause: Transparency is one of our core values at Snap.
label: none

clause: We believe there shouldn’t be any surprises about the data we collect and how we use it — that’s why we’re upfront with how we process it.
label: none

clause: For example, we process your information to provide you a more personalized experience, including to show you content and information that is most relevant to your experience, as well as more relevant advertisements.
label: none

clause: Understanding your interests and preferences help us provide a better product experience.
label: none

clause: Furthermore, we believe a personalized experience should not come at the expense of your privacy.
label: none

clause: Just like in real life, there are some moments you want to share privately with your close friends, and others that you want to share publicly.
label: none

clause: That’s why from day one our philosophy has been to delete content by default and to give Snapchatters control by providing the tools that allow them to decide what happens with their content, like who to share it with or when to save it.
label: none

clause: This Policy covers our Snapchat app as well as our other products, services, and features, such as Bitmoji, Spectacles, and our advertising and commerce initiatives.
label: none

clause: When you read "Services" in this Policy, we’re talking about all of them.
label: none

clause: Also, if you see us refer to our "Terms," we mean the Terms of Service that you agree to when you sign up for our Services.
label: none

clause: Finally, if you see the term "Snapchatter" we are often using that as shorthand for any user of our Services.
label: none

clause: Let’s get started with the controls you have over your information: Control Over Your Information Control over your information and settings is a core part of Snapchat experience.
label: none

clause: You can access, update, and delete your information, decide who can contact you, and download your data from within the Snapchat app.
label: none

clause: Below, we give you more details on the types of settings that are available, link out to our data download tool, and provide instructions on how to delete data or your account.
label: none

clause: We want you to be in control of your information, so we provide you with a range of tools, including: Access and update your information.
label: none

clause: You can access and edit most of your basic account information right in our Services.
label: none

clause: Just navigate to your settings and you will see the options available to you.
label: none

clause: If you want to delete your account, learn how here.
label: none

clause: You can also delete some information within our Services, like content you’ve saved to Memories, content you’ve shared with My AI, Spotlight submissions, and more.
label: none

clause: We’ve built a number of tools that let you choose who you share your content with.
label: none

clause: In some cases you may want to share content with your friends, and in other instances you may want to share it with the public.
label: none

clause: Snapchat is intended for close friends and family, that’s why we’ve built controls that help you decide who can contact you.
label: none

clause: If you receive unwanted communications, you can always block and report that person.
label: none

clause: In most cases, you can change your permissions at any time.
label: none

clause: For example, by default you are findable to others through your phone number and/or email address that you provided.
label: none

clause: If you no longer want to be findable, you can always change your settings.
label: none

clause: Or if you provided access to your phone or third party platform contacts to make friending easier, you can change that later on in your app settings.
label: data_sharing

clause: Of course, if you do that, certain features and Services, like finding friends in your contact book, won’t work.
label: none

clause: You have the option to opt out or unsubscribe from promotional emails and messages sent by SMS or other messaging platforms.
label: none

clause: To do so, just follow the instructions in the message like an unsubscribe link or similar functionality.
label: none

clause: You can make a request in our Download My Data tool to export a copy of your Snapchat information.
label: none

clause: Depending on where you live and the particular data we are processing, you may have the right to object to our processing of that information.
label: none

clause: This gets a bit technical, so we’ve explained it in more detail here.
label: none

clause: We try to show you ads that we think will be relevant to your interests, but if you’d like to have a less personalized experience, you can change your advertising settings in the Snapchat app.
label: none

clause: If you use an iPhone with iOS 14.5 or above, some specific requirements apply, which we’ve specified here.
label: none

clause: Information We Collect This section provides you with details on what information we collect: what you provide to us, what we collect when you use Snapchat, and information we receive from other companies or apps you’ve connected to your Snapchat account.
label: none

clause: Sometimes, we may also collect additional information, with your permission.
label: none

clause: When you use our Services, such as Snapchat, we collect information you provide to us, generate information when you use our Services, and in some cases receive data from others.
label: none

clause: Information You Provide Many of our Services require you to set up an account.
label: none

clause: To do this, we ask you to provide us with account details (information about you, like your name, username, email address, birthday, and phone number).
label: none

clause: When you set up your profile, you’ll also provide us with profile details (like your Bitmoji and profile picture).
label: none

clause: If you use our commerce products to buy something, like those latest sneakers, we may ask you for payment and related information (like your physical address, so we can ship the product to you, payment information, so we can process the payment, and transaction history).
label: none

clause: Of course, you’ll also provide us with information you send through or save within our Services, including content and information about that content, and content you share and generate with our AI Features (content, or “Inputs,” including text, images, video, audio, precise location, and engagement, used to generate content and responses, or “Outputs”).
label: location

clause: We consider some of this information to be private content and communications (like Snaps and Chats with friends, voice and video calls, and content that is saved in My Eyes Only).
label: none

clause: Or content you share with a particular audience like private & friend stories (My Story set to Friends, Private Stories).
label: none

clause: On the other end of the spectrum, some of the information you send through or save within our Services may be public content that is accessible to everyone (such as Public Story content, including My Story set to Everyone, Shared Stories, and Community Stories, Spotlight or Snap Map submissions, and Public Profile information).
label: none

clause: Keep in mind that Snapchatters who view your Snaps, Chats, and any other content, can always screenshot that content, save it, or copy it outside the Snapchat app.
label: none

clause: So please don’t send messages or share content that you wouldn’t want someone to save or share.
label: none

clause: Lastly, when you contact Support (content and communications shared with Support) or our Safety team, or communicate with us in any other way, including through our research efforts (like responses to surveys, consumer panels, or other research questions) we’ll collect whatever information you provide or that we need to resolve your question.
label: none

clause: Information We Generate When You Use Our Services When you use our Services, we collect information about which of those Services you’ve used and how you’ve used them.
label: none

clause: This helps us better understand the way our community uses our Services so that we can make improvements.
label: none

clause: This includes usage information (information about how you interact with our Services — for example, which Lenses you view and apply, your premium subscriptions, Stories you watch, and how often you interact with other Snapchatters) and content information (information about content you create or provide, your engagement with the camera and creative tools, your interactions with My AI, and metadata — for example, information about the content itself like the date and time it was posted and who viewed it).
label: none

clause: Content information includes information based on the content of the image, video, or audio — so if you post a Spotlight of a basketball game, we may use that information to show you more content on Spotlight about basketball.
label: none

clause: This also includes device information (such as your hardware or software, operating system, device memory, advertising identifiers, apps installed, browser type, information from device sensors that measure the motion of your device or compasses and microphones, including whether you have headphones connected, and information about your wireless and mobile connections), location information (IP address), information collected by cookies and similar technologies, depending on your settings, (cookies, pixels (small graphic data that recognize user activity, such as if and how often a user has visited a website), web storage, unique advertising identifiers), and log information (such as details about how you’ve used our Services, access times, pages viewed, IP address, and unique identifiers like cookies).
label: tracking

clause: If you’ve explicitly granted device-level permissions, device information may also include information about your device phonebook (contacts and related information), images and other information from your device’s camera, photos, and microphone (like the ability to take photos, videos, view stored photos and videos, and access the microphone to record audio while recording video), and location information (precise location through methods like GPS signals).
label: location

clause: Data We Receive From Others The last category of data we collect is information about you that we may receive from others, such as other users, our affiliates, and third parties.
label: none

clause: This includes linked third-party service data (information we get when you link your Snapchat account to another service), data from advertisers (information from advertisers, app developers, publishers, and other third parties to help target or measure the performance of ads), contact info from other Snapchatters or third parties (if another Snapchatter uploads their contact list which includes your information, we may combine that with other information we have about you to better understand who you may want to communicate with.
label: data_sharing

clause: Or, if you provide us with your contact information, we may use that to determine if we can communicate with you in other ways, like SMS, email, or other messaging services), and data relating to potential violations of our Terms (we may receive information from third parties, including website publishers, social network providers, law enforcement, and others, about potential violators of our Terms of Service and Community Guidelines).
label: none

clause: Other Information, With Your Permission Additionally, there may be instances when you interact with our Services that we will ask your permission to collect additional information.
label: none

clause: For example, before accessing your device’s camera roll or your device or third party contact book.
label: data_sharing

clause: How We Use Information This section explains how we use the information we collect.
label: none

clause: Among other things, we use the information we collect to provide you with personalized products and Services that we work hard to build and improve.
label: none

clause: Below, we walk through each purpose for which we use information in detail.
label: none

clause: If you’d like to see a mapping of the data we collect with the purposes for which we collect it, we have a table here.
label: none

clause: Keep Things Up & Running (i.e., operate, deliver, and maintain our Services) We use the information we collect in order to operate, deliver, and maintain our Services.
label: none

clause: For example, by delivering a Snap you want to send to a friend or, if you share your location on Snap Map, to show you suggestions like places you might like in your neighborhood, content others have posted to the Map, or your friends if they’re sharing their location with you.
label: none

clause: We also use some of your information to help keep our products up to date, for example to make sure that our Services work with the latest operating systems and devices.
label: none

clause: Personalize Your Experience & Give Context We offer personalized Services to Snapchatters.
label: none

clause: One of the ways we do this is by showing you content that is relevant to you or we think you may enjoy based on the information you share with us.
label: none

clause: To do so, we use information about you across different areas of the Services in order to add context to your Snapchat experience.
label: none

clause: For example, we automatically tag content with labels based on the content, your location, or the time of day.
label: none

clause: So if there's a dog in the photo, it may be searchable in Memories by the term “dog,” show up on the Map at the location where you created the Memory, and inform us that you’re into dogs so we can surface you fun dog videos and dog food ads in other parts of our Services, such as Spotlight.
label: none

clause: Personalization can also help with suggesting friends or recommending a new friend to send a Snap to based on who you Snap with the most.
label: none

clause: We may show recommended places on the Snap Map, generate stickers, or even generate Snaps and other content using AI, infer your interests based on your content or activity, or customize the content we show you, including ads.
label: none

clause: For example, if you watch barista content on Spotlight, talk to My AI about your favorite espresso machine, or save a lot of coffee-related Snaps in your Memories, we may highlight coffee shops on the Snap Map when you visit a new city or show you content about coffee that you may find interesting or relevant.
label: none

clause: Or, if you interact with a lot of music venues we may use that to show you ads for upcoming shows in town.
label: none

clause: Personalization also includes tailoring your experience based on who you interact with most and what your friends are doing, including showing you content your friends create, like, or enjoy on Spotlight or Place recommendations that are popular with your friends.
label: none

clause: Our goal is to continuously provide you with more relevant and interesting content.
label: none

clause: For example, if you watch a lot of sports content, but skip content with hair and makeup tips, our recommendation algorithms will prioritize sports, but not those makeup tips.
label: none

clause: You can learn more about how we understand Snapchatter preferences and rank and moderate content here.
label: none

clause: We believe it is critical to also balance the benefits of personalization with our Snapchatters’ expectations of privacy.
label: none

clause: For example, we may automatically tag the Snaps you save to Memories based on the content within it (e.g., the Snap contained a dog), and then use that tag to personalize your experience, make recommendations, or show you ads (such as showing you Spotlight Snaps containing dogs).
label: none

clause: We do not use the private content and communications you send to your friends to personalize your experience, make recommendations, or show you ads.
label: none

clause: Provide Relevant Ads Another way we provide a personalized Service is through the ads we show.
label: none

clause: We use your interests and preferences from the information we’ve collected to personalize, target, and measure ads.
label: none

clause: We think ads are best when they’re relevant.
label: none

clause: That’s why we try to select the right ads and show them to you at the right time.
label: none

clause: For example, if you’ve interacted with ads for video games, we will infer that you like video games, and show you similar ads, but those won’t be the only ads you see.
label: none

clause: Similar to our content strategy, we try to ensure you receive a variety of ads.
label: none

clause: We also use your information to avoid showing you ads you probably won’t be interested in.
label: none

clause: For example, if a ticketing site tells us you’ve previously bought tickets for a movie — we can stop showing you ads for it.
label: none

label: none

clause: Generative AI models learn the patterns and structure of their input training data and then generate new data that has similar characteristics).

label: none

label: none

clause: Studying data from Snapchatters can help us see trends in the ways that people use the Services.

clause: How Long We Keep Your Information In this section we provide you with information on how long we keep your information, why we keep your information, and also highlight how we may need to keep your information to comply with laws, courts, and other obligations.
label: none

clause: As a general rule, we keep information as long as you tell us to, and otherwise as long as we need it to provide our Services, or as required by law.
label: none

clause: For example, if you store something in Memories, we will keep it as long as you need it, but when you Chat with a friend, our systems are designed to delete Chats you send within 24 hours after your friend reads it (unless you’ve changed your default settings or decide to save it).
label: none

clause: Whether we retain your data depends on the specific feature, your settings, and how you’re using the Services.
label: none

clause: Here are some more factors we consider when we decide how long to keep your information: If we need the information to operate or provide our Services.
label: none

clause: For example, we store your basic account details — like your name, phone number, and email address — to maintain your account.
label: none

clause: To do the things you expect from our Services and as we’ve described within this Privacy Policy.
label: none

clause: For example, we maintain your list of friends until you ask us to delete them since friends are key to expressing yourself.
label: none

clause: Similarly, we keep your shared list of contacts until you ask us to remove them in our app settings (note: updating your device permissions may not remove the contacts you’ve previously shared with Snapchat).
label: none

clause: Conversely, Snaps and Chats sent in Snapchat will be deleted by default from our servers within 24 hours after we detect they’ve been opened by all recipients or have expired, unless you’ve changed your default settings or decide to save something, in which case we will honor your choices.
label: none

clause: For example, we store location information for different lengths of time based on how precise it is and which Services you use.
label: none

clause: If location information is associated with a Snap — like those saved to Memories or posted to Snap Map or Spotlight — we’ll retain that location as long as we store the Snap.
label: none

clause: Pro tip: You can see the location data we retain about you by downloading your data.
label: location

clause: How long we need to retain the information to comply with certain legal obligations.
label: none

clause: If we need it for other legitimate purposes, such as to prevent harm, investigate possible violations of our Terms of Service or other policies, investigate reports of abuse, or protect ourselves or others.
label: none

clause: Take a look at our Privacy by Product page and support page for details on the specific retention periods for products.
label: none

clause: Although our systems are designed to delete some of your information automatically, we cannot promise that deletion will take place by a specific time.
label: none

clause: In some cases we need to comply with legal requirements to store your data which stops us from deleting your information.
label: none

clause: For example, if we receive a notice from a court asking us to keep a copy of your content.
label: none

clause: Tailored advertising controls What is tailored advertising?
label: none

clause: This is when we use information about your use of our services and other websites and mobile apps to tailor ads to be more relevant to you.
label: none

clause: This is also known as interest based advertising, targeted advertising, or ‘sharing’ for purposes of cross-context behavioural advertising.
label: none

clause: An example of tailored advertising is when an advertising partner provides us with information indicating that you may be interested in cars.
label: none

clause: This could enable us to show you ads about cars.
label: none

clause: How to control tailored advertising: You can control tailored advertising on your Account Privacy page under ‘Tailored Ads’.

label: none

label: none

label: none

label: none

label: none

label: none

label: none

label: none

clause: Individuals who are residents of the State of California have certain individual rights, which are outlined below.
label: none

clause: Right To Know About Personal Information Collected or Disclosed.
label: none

clause: As a California resident, you have the right to request additional information, beyond that disclosed above, regarding the following, to the extent applicable: the categories of personal information the Company collected about you the categories of sources from which that personal information was collected the business or commercial purposes for which that information was collected, sold, or shared the categories of third parties to whom the information was disclosed the specific pieces of personal information collected Upon receipt of a verifiable request to know (see below), and as required by applicable law, we will provide a response to such request.
label: none

clause: Right To Request Deletion of Your Personal Information.
label: none

clause: You have the right to request that we delete the personal information we collected or maintain about you.
label: none

clause: Once we receive your request, we will let you know what, if any, personal information we can delete from our records, and will direct any service providers and contractors to whom we disclosed your personal information to also delete your personal information from their records.
label: none

clause: There may be circumstances where we cannot delete your personal information or direct service providers or contractors to delete your personal information from their records.
label: none

clause: Such instances include, without limitation, when the information at issue is maintained: (a) to enable solely internal uses that are reasonably aligned with your expectations based on your relationship with the Company and compatible with the context in which you provided the information, or (b) to comply with a legal obligation.
label: none

clause: Upon receipt of a verifiable request to delete (see below), and as required by applicable law, we will provide a response to such requests.
label: none

clause: You have the right to request that the Company correct any inaccurate personal information we maintain about you, taking into account the nature of that information and purpose for processing it.
label: none

clause: Upon receipt of a verifiable request to correct (see below), and as required by the CCPA, we will provide a response to such requests.
label: none

label: none

label: none

clause: Upon receipt of a verifiable consumer request, and as required by the CCPA, we will take appropriate steps to respond to your request.
label: none

clause: Right to Non-Discrimination for the Exercise of Your Privacy Rights.
label: none

label: none

label: none

clause: We reserve the right to only respond to verifiable consumer requests that are submitted as instructed.

label: none

label: none

clause: Discord Privacy Policy Effective: September 29, 2025 Last Updated: August 29, 2025 1.
label: none

clause: The information we collect • Information you provide to us • Information we collect automatically • Information we receive from other sources 4.
label: none

clause: Information about local privacy laws 13.
label: none

clause: This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store, protect, and share your personal information through our services.
label: none

clause: If you reside in the European Economic Area (“EEA”), Discord Netherlands BV is the “data controller” of your personal information collected through the services (as defined in our Terms of Service).
label: none

clause: It’s important that you read this entire policy, but here’s a summary to get you started: We care a lot about privacy.
label: none

clause: We are committed to enabling you to build meaningful connections around the joy of playing games through voice, video and text features.
label: none

clause: Respecting user privacy is a key part of that mission.
label: none

clause: We don’t sell your personal information.
label: none

clause: Our business is funded through subscriptions, paid products, and sponsored content, not based on selling your personal information to third parties.
label: none

clause: We require the information that enables us to create your account, provide and maintain our services, meet our commitments to our users, and satisfy our legal requirements.
label: none

clause: Our dedicated Trust and Safety team works hard to help keep our users safe.
label: none

clause: We also use certain information to help us identify violations of our terms and policies (such as our Community Guidelines) in order to prevent harmful content or conduct on the services.
label: none

clause: We give you the ability to control your privacy on Discord.
label: none

clause: A little bit about Discord Discord enables you to build meaningful connections around the joy of playing games through voice, video, and text features.
label: none

clause: Whether you’re part of a club, gaming group, or just a handful of friends that want to spend time together, Discord makes it easy to connect with friends.
label: none

clause: Our “services” has the same meaning as defined in the Terms of Service.
label: none

clause: They include the Discord app, which can be accessed on mobile, web, desktop, console, or even a connected home appliance—any device with a web browser and internet connection.
label: none

clause: We also have a website, blog, and support center, and we may collect your information through other means like surveys, emails, and social media.
label: none

clause: If we build another product, our services include that too.
label: none

clause: As explained in our Terms of Service, we allow users to add content to the services in a number of different ways, including via direct messages and in smaller and larger spaces.
label: none

clause: If you share content within larger spaces, that content may be accessed by many people, including people you do not know.
label: none

clause: For example, some servers are available in the Server Discovery section of the app and do not require an invite link to join.
label: none

clause: Other server owners may publish their server invite link on public websites.
label: none

clause: Anyone can access these servers, and you should be aware that server owners or admins set these permissions, and like the size of a server, the permissions may change over time.
label: none

clause: We may also use content posted in larger spaces to help us develop, improve, and power our services, including features that help you catch up on conversations and safety features that identify harmful content on the services and support the enforcement of our Terms of Service and Community Guidelines.
label: none

clause: These things are important to us, and we believe they will make Discord even better for our users.
label: none

clause: We will always try to let you know the type of space you are in (although we don’t control where invite links are shared or the permissions for that server).
label: none

clause: You can limit the extent to which your content is used for these purposes as described in the “How to control your privacy” section below.
label: none

clause: You can learn more about our approach to safety and content moderation, including how we use your information for these purposes, in our Safety Center.
label: none

clause: You should take all of this into account when you are using our services, and choose the spaces, features, and settings that are most appropriate for your content.
label: none

clause: We don’t make money from selling your personal information to third parties.
label: none

clause: Our business is funded through subscriptions, paid products, and sponsored content (like Quests and other sponsored formats).
label: none

clause: The information we collect We collect certain information when you use Discord.
label: none

clause: This includes information you provide to us, information we collect automatically, and information we receive from other sources.
label: none

clause: Information you provide to us Account information.
label: none

clause: When you create a Discord account, you can come up with a username and password, and provide a way of contacting you (such as an email address and/or phone number).
label: none

clause: You’ll also need to provide your birthday.
label: none

clause: In some cases, we may require additional information to verify your age.
label: none

clause: You may be required to verify your account or provide additional information (like a verified phone number) to your account.
label: none

clause: You may also have the option to add your name or choose a display name.
label: none

clause: This includes any content that you upload to the service.
label: none

clause: For example, you may write messages or posts (including drafts), send voice messages, create custom emojis, or post other content that you create with features that we develop.
label: none

clause: You may also upload and share files through the services.
label: none

clause: This also includes your profile information and the information you provide when you create servers.
label: none

clause: We generally do not store the contents of video or voice calls or channels.
label: none

clause: If we were to change that in the future (for example, to facilitate content moderation), we would disclose that to you in advance.
label: none

clause: We also don’t store streaming content when you share your screen, but we do retain the thumbnail cover image for the stream for a short period of time.
label: none

clause: We may build features that help users engage with voice and video content, like create or send short recordings.
label: none

clause: If you buy any paid services through Discord, you may need to submit a valid payment method and associated billing information, including your full name and billing address.
label: none

clause: Our payment processors, like Stripe and PayPal, receive and process your payment information.
label: none

clause: Depending on the processor, we may also receive and store certain billing information, including the last four digits of the credit card number associated with the transaction.
label: none

clause: If you sell something through Discord, you may be required to provide additional information to Discord or to our payment processors, such as bank account information to facilitate payments, tax identification information, and copies of government issued identification required to identify users in accordance with regulatory obligations.
label: none

clause: If we decide to process our own payments in the future, we would receive and process this information ourselves.
label: none

clause: We collect information about your use of Discord and your activities on the services.
label: none

clause: This includes information such as the friends you add, the users, bots, and apps you engage with, the servers or other communities you join and participate in, your roles in servers, content moderation decisions you make, information about purchases or sales you make on or through Discord including what you purchased or sold, and other related actions.
label: none

clause: We may also collect limited information from your device while Discord is running (such as the game you are playing).
label: none

clause: You can control the extent to which we collect, use, and display this information as described in the “How to control your privacy” section below.
label: none

clause: Certain features, like contact syncing, may require that you provide additional information (or grant us access to such information) to make them work.
label: none

clause: This also includes if you choose to interact with sponsored content, enable integrations, or authorize third-party services to share data with us.
label: data_sharing

clause: For example, when you link a music streaming or game account, we may collect information about that account such as the song you are listening to or the game you are playing in order to display that information on your profile or as your status (if you have chosen to do so).
label: none

clause: Other information you provide directly to us.
label: none

clause: You may have the option to submit additional information as you use Discord.
label: none

clause: Core automated processes Uber uses automated processes to enable certain parts of our services, including functions essential to our business such as matching, pricing, safety, and fraud detection and prevention.
label: none

clause: Uber relies on automated processes to enable essential parts of our services, including matching (pairing users requesting and providing transportation and/or delivery services), pricing (determining the amount you are owed for providing such services), safety and fraud detection and prevention.
label: none

clause: These processes allow Uber to provide a seamless and safe experience to millions of users globally every day.
label: none

clause: This section describes how automated matching, pricing, safety, and fraud prevention and detection work, including how they impact your Uber experience and the personal and non-personal data used to enable these processes.
label: none

clause: You may contact Uber here if you have questions or concerns regarding these processes.
label: none

clause: Matching Uber uses algorithms and machine learning models to efficiently match riders and Drivers, or Delivery People and order recipients.
label: none

clause: The matching process is triggered when riders or order recipients request transportation or deliveries through Uber.
label: none

clause: Our algorithms then evaluate various factors to determine the best match for a given trip or delivery request based on the available Drivers/Delivery People in the area.
label: none

clause: These factors include your location, proximity to the rider/order recipient, requested destination, traffic conditions and historical data (including, in some markets, whether you and the rider have previously reported having negative experiences with each other).
label: none

clause: The trip or delivery request is then communicated to you and other Drivers/Delivery Persons matched through this process.
label: none

clause: Once a ride or delivery is accepted, we send confirmation of the match to the Driver/Delivery Person and the rider/order recipient.
label: none

clause: We continually refine our matching process to provide the best experience to all users on our platform, and may consider different factors depending on where you use Uber.
label: none

clause: Additional information on Uber’s matching process is available here.
label: none

clause: Pricing When you provide transportation or a delivery, Uber uses algorithms to determine the amount you’re paid.
label: none

clause: If you are in a city where the fare is calculated per minute and per mile, you’ll earn a base fare plus additional money for the time and distance you travel (these rates vary by city).
label: none

clause: If you are in a city where Uber provides an upfront fare that you can review before determining whether to accept the ride or delivery, such fares are calculated based on factors including the current driving conditions, similar destinations, demand for rides at that time, surcharges and reimbursement for tolls, surge pricing and promotions.
label: none

clause: Uber’s service fees are subtracted from all fares.
label: none

clause: Additional information on Uber’s pricing process is available here (Drivers) and here (Delivery People).
label: none

clause: Safety, security, and fraud prevention and detection Uber uses algorithms and machine learning models to prevent and detect safety incidents or fraud against Uber or our users.
label: none

clause: This includes efforts to monitor for account takeovers, unauthorized account sharing, altered or false document submissions, duplicate or fake accounts and other suspicious user behaviors.
label: none

clause: For example, Uber uses identity verification tools, like Real-Time ID Check, to help verify that your account is being used by you and not someone pretending to be you.
label: none

clause: The Real-Time ID Check process requires Drivers/Delivery People to occasionally take a real-time selfie before going online.
label: none

clause: Where permitted by law, we may also use facial recognition technology to compare your selfie to your profile photo to verify that you are the person using your account, and that it is not being used by other people.
label: none

clause: We also use automated processes to validate your ID documents and profile photo associated with your account.
label: none

clause: These include checks to verify that (1) the driver’s license you submit at or after onboarding is valid, unaltered, and not associated with any other account; and (2) the profile photo you submit is of a real person and isn’t digitally altered, manipulated or associated with any other account.* If these processes flag your documents or photos as potentially fraudulent or not a match, specialized customer support agents will manually review them.
label: none

clause: If these agents determine that the documents or photos are invalid, don’t match or are otherwise noncompliant, your account may be deactivated.
label: none

clause: You have the right to appeal deactivation of your account.
label: none

clause: Please go here for more information on Uber’s deactivation process.
label: none

clause: Uber also uses tools that look for patterns that may indicate fraudulent or unsafe behavior, such as those which vary significantly from typical user behavior.
label: none

clause: To do this, Uber performs real-time monitoring of information collected from or generated by users, including location data, payment information and Uber usage.
label: location

clause: We also examine historical data and compare it against real-time data to help detect suspicious behavior.
label: none

clause: Uber may limit your access to our services, or require that you undertake a particular action such as verifying your identity before allowing such access, if Uber detects potential fraudulent or unsafe activity.
label: none

clause: You may contact Uber Support here if you have questions or concerns about these processes.
label: none

clause: This process generally takes around 2 months from the time the deletion request was made.
label: none

clause: As with any deletion process, things like routine maintenance, unexpected outages, bugs, or failures in our protocols may cause delays in the processes and time frames defined in this policy.
label: none

clause: We maintain systems designed to detect and remediate such issues.
label: none

clause: How Waze retains data we collect Some data you can delete whenever you like, some data is deleted automatically, and some data we retain for longer periods of time when necessary.
label: none

clause: This section describes why we hold onto different types of data for different periods of time.
label: none

clause: Information retained until you remove it - such as your “Home, “work”, favorites, email address and other account related information.
label: none

label: none

clause: Data that expires after a specific period of time - in some cases, you don’t need to actively delete your information as we set retention timeframes based on the reason for the data’s collection.
label: none

clause: For example, if you choose to connect your calendar to your Waze Account, we extract your calendar events for several days in advance and delete them after their occurrence.
label: none

clause: We may also take steps to anonymize certain data within set time periods.
label: none

clause: Information retained until your Waze Account is deleted - we may keep some data for the life of your Waze Account if it’s useful for helping us understand how users interact with our features and how we can improve our services.
label: none

label: none

label: none

label: tracking

label: tracking

clause: Some of the cookies may expire when the session ends and you exit your browser.

label: tracking

clause: How Long We Store Your Personal Information We retain Personal Information for as long as needed or is permitted in context of the purpose for which it was collected and consistent with applicable law.
label: none

label: none

label: none

label: none

clause: We retain biometric data for as long as needed or permitted given the purpose for which it was collected and no more than 3 years after your account closes, unless otherwise required by applicable law.

clause: AI and Automated Decision Making We may process your Personal Information using AI and/or Automated Decision Making technology under the circumstances described below: Automated Decision Making.
label: ai_decisions

clause: PayPal uses Automated Decision Making technology to make assessments or decisions, including related to risk, fraud and creditworthiness, where permitted and in accordance with applicable law.
label: ai_decisions

clause: Our Automated Decision Making technology may use profiling techniques to evaluate personal aspects about you, including to analyze or predict your economic situation, reliability and/or behavior.
label: ai_decisions

clause: This enables us to assess, for example, whether you display traits indicating possible credit or financial risk, money laundering or fraudulent activity, that are inconsistent with any submissions you have made to us, or that suggest you have hidden your real identity.
label: none

clause: In making an Automated Decision, PayPal may process Users’ Personal Information.
label: ai_decisions

clause: If we determine that you pose a credit, fraud, money laundering or other risk, we may refuse to provide new services to you, stop providing services you currently use, or place limits or restrictions on the services you use.
label: none

clause: Users may exercise rights related to Automated Decision Making, as described in Your Data Protection Rights.
label: ai_decisions

clause: PayPal is committed to offering innovative and personalized experiences, and we may, directly or through our trusted partners, provide you with access to Agentic AI tools (“Agentic AI Tools”).
label: none

clause: These AI tools are designed to operate with a degree of autonomy, enabling them to perform tasks, make recommendations, and even initiate actions on your behalf, all while learning from your interactions.
label: none

clause: Agentic AI Tools leverage generative AI technology to enhance your experience on the PayPal platform.
label: none

clause: We encourage you to carefully consider the recommendations and actions of Agentic AI Tools.
label: none

clause: Our Agentic AI Tools are not designed to make decisions that have legal or similarly significant effects, such as decisions with legal, medical, financial, or employment implications, and you must not use (or attempt to use) them for any such purpose.
label: none

clause: These tools are intended only to provide general assistance and insights, and you should not rely on them to replace your own judgement and expertise.
label: none

clause: Agentic AI Tools require access to certain information to function effectively.
label: none

clause: When you use these tools, they will have access to your Personal Information, including queries, preferences, interests, purchase history, and payment information.

clause: PayPal Privacy Statement Our Use of Cookies and Tracking Technologies Our Use of Cookies and Tracking Technologies When you interact with our Services, open email we send you, or visit a third-party website for which we provide Services, we and our partners use Cookies to grant you access to our Sites, Services, applications and tools, recognize you as a user, customize your online experiences and online content, including to serve you interest-based advertising, perform analytics, mitigate risk and prevent potential fraud, and promote trust and safety across our Services.
label: data_sharing

clause: We use Cookies to collect your device information, internet activity information, and generate inferences as described above.
label: tracking

clause: Where appropriate, security measures are set in place to prevent unauthorized access to our Cookies and similar technologies.
label: tracking

clause: A unique identifier ensures that only we and/or our authorized service providers have access to Cookie data.
label: none

clause: Service providers are companies that help us with various aspects of our business, such as Sites operations, Services, applications, advertisements and tools.
label: none

clause: We may use some authorized service providers to help us to serve you relevant ads on our Services and other places on the internet.
label: none

clause: These service providers may also place Cookies on your device via our Services (third-party Cookies).
label: data_sharing

clause: They may also collect information that helps them identify your device, such as IP-address or other unique device identifiers.
label: tracking

clause: Certain aspects and features of our Services and Sites are only available through the use of Cookies, so if you choose to disable or decline Cookies through your device or browser settings, your use of the Sites and Services may be limited or not possible.
label: tracking

clause: Do Not Track Some web browsers have an optional setting called “Do Not Track” (“DNT”) that lets you opt-out of being tracked by advertisers and some third parties.
label: tracking

clause: Because many of our services won’t function without tracking data, we do not respond to DNT settings.
label: tracking

clause: If you want to know more about how we use cookies, please review our Statement on Cookies and Tracking Technologies.
label: tracking

clause: To learn how to opt-out of this kind of tracking technology, visit About Ads.
label: tracking

clause: PayPal Privacy Statement Your Data Protection Rights Your Data Protection Rights Under applicable data protection laws, depending upon the country in which you reside, and subject to applicable exceptions and definitional differences among various laws, you may have certain rights about how your Personal Information is collected, stored, used and shared.
label: none

clause: Whether you decide to exercise your privacy rights or not, we will not discriminate or deny you services, charge you different prices, or provide you with a different level of service solely for exercising your privacy rights.
label: none

clause: Although, certain personalized services for PayPal customers may not provide the same level of personalization if you decide to limit the amount of Personal Information you share with us.
label: none

clause: How you can exercise your rights We recognize the importance of your ability to control the use of your Personal Information and provide several ways for you to exercise your privacy rights.
label: none

clause: If you, or an authorized agent, where permitted, want to exercise any of your rights relating to your Personal Information in your account profile(s), please follow the instructions on how to exercise your data protection rights below.
label: none

label: none

clause: We may first need to verify who you are before we can respond to your request.
label: none

label: none

clause: We will compare the information you submit against our internal business records to verify your identity.
label: none

clause: If we can’t verify your identity, we may not be able to fulfill your request, unless the right does not require verification.
label: none

clause: If we deny your request in whole or in part, you may have the right to be informed of the reasons we have for not taking action and regarding the possibility to appeal our decision or lodging a complaint with a supervisory authority and seeking judicial remedy.

label: none

clause: PayPal Privacy Statement How We Protect Your Personal Information How We Protect Your Personal Information We maintain technical, physical, and administrative security measures designed to provide reasonable protection for your Personal Information against loss, misuse, interference, unauthorized access, disclosure, and alteration.
label: none

clause: The security measures include firewalls, data encryption, physical access controls to our data centers, and information access authorization controls.

clause: Our Lawful Basis for Processing Personal Information We may process your Personal Information in accordance with the lawful bases below under the General Data Protection Regulation	Types of Data	Lawful basis and special condition for processing (if relevant) These processing purposes include: to provide our Services, to fulfil relevant agreements with you and to otherwise administer our business relationship with you; to administer your payment for products and the customer relationship; to assess your creditworthiness in connection with your application, confirm your identity and your contact information, and protect you and others from fraud; to confirm your identity, also through the use of electronic signature, and verify your personal and contact details; to prove that transactions have been executed; to establish, exercise or defend a legal claim or collection procedure; to comply with internal procedures; to assess which payment options and services to offer you, for example by carrying out internal and external credit assessments; for customer analysis, to administer our Services, and for internal operations, for example troubleshooting, data analysis, testing, research and statistical purposes; to communicate with you in relation to our Services; to promote the security of the Services; to comply with applicable laws, such as AML and bookkeeping laws and rules issued by our designated banks and relevant card networks; specifically for Visa+, we will receive the recipient’s name and payment information from Visa and third-party Visa+ participating digital wallets for the purpose of processing and matching Visa+ payment transactions between participating digital wallets and PayPal; For Fastlane users, we may recognize you as a Fastlane user when you shop on participating Partner and Merchant sites, and we may prompt you to engage in participating Partner or Merchant interactions, such as registering for a store or loyalty account using your Fastlane profile.
label: data_sharing

clause: We will also use your Personal Information and payment method details to determine whether the payment you are making with a participating Partner or Merchant is authorized by you and likely to be successfully authorized by the payment method you choose to use when you make a purchase using details from your Fastlane profile; and provide receipts in connection with PayPal Point of Sale services.
label: none

clause: For buyers using our PayPal Point of Sale services (including Venmo Tap to Pay), you may choose to provide us your contact details so that we can send you digital receipts.
label: none

clause: If you provide your e-mail address or mobile number to a Partner or Merchant who uses PayPal Point of Sale, we may remember your details for the next time you buy something from a Merchant who uses PayPal Point of Sale in its physical store, if you use the same payment card.
label: none

clause: This is regardless of whether you have previously bought something from this Merchant or not.
label: none

clause: This means that your e-mail address or mobile number will be pre-filled in the receipt view for your convenience the next time you buy something from a Merchant who uses PayPal Point of Sale in its physical store.
label: none

label: tracking
